content.description: Key To The Highway starts just uphill of the massive roof system on the right side of the Treeline Dome. A few gear placements lead up to a steep, obtuse corner with some powerful and reachy moves (crux-5.11b) before pulling up on to the lower angle slab above (5.10b/c). Continue up the line of bolts up to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: There are just a few natural placements in a corner to start. It is bolt protected climbing for the rest of the pitch.

content.description: Further On Up The Road starts just downhill(left) of the huge roof system on the right side of the Treeline Dome. It starts up an old existing line of bolts that diagonals the face leftward... F.O.U.T.R. branches right after a few older bolts and climbs the steep featured headwall (5.10d) straight up. Surmount the large ledge, and continue past a few more bolts on the slab above to the 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Bolts protect this climb up to a 2-bolt anchor. Great climbing!
